alert.note: Alert for Curry County Coast; Eastern Curry County and Josephine County; South Central Oregon Coast (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:02AM PST until February 22 at 10:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM PST TUESDAY ABOVE 1500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 1500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches below 2000 foot elevations and 3 to 6 inches above 2000 foot elevations. Locally higher amounts are possible in the Kalmiopsis Wildernesses and in the coastal mountains. * WHERE...Elevations above 1500 feet in Coos, Curry, and Douglas counties including the towns of Obrien, Takilma, Galice, and Sunny Valley. This includes Interstate 5 north of Grants Pass at Canyon Mountain and Sexton Summit. Portions of Highway 199 in the Illinois Valley will also be affected, as well as the coastal mountains and Kalmiopsis Wilderness. * WHEN...Until 10 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult due to slick, snow covered roads. The hazardous conditions are likely to impact holiday travel Monday as well as the Tuesday morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels and accumulation level are likely to rise to near 2000 foot elevations Monday afternoon. Snowfall rates are likely to be greatest Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com or http://quickmap.dot.ca.gov for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.
